basics.name: Coleman (Cole) Martin
basics.label: Chemical Engineer | Diagnostics & ML
basics.summary: Chemical engineer specialized in isothermal nucleic acid amplification, lateral-flow diagnostics, and applied machine learning/computer vision for point-of-care testing. Experience spans assay design, analytical performance characterization, and regulated bioprocess environments.

work.name: University of Washington — Posner Research Group
work.summary: Assay development for point-of-care viral diagnostics.
highlights: Designed and optimized recombinase polymerase amplification (RPA) assays for HCV viral-load quantification.

work.name: University of Washington — Posner Research Group
work.summary: Developed point-of-care assays and readouts for SARS-CoV-2 and HIV.
highlights: Designed and optimized RPA assays for SARS-CoV-2 and HIV viral-load quantification.
Built duplex lateral-flow readout with integrated full-process internal controls (lysis, RT, amplification, detection).
Applied viscous dampening and deep learning (ResNet) to expand quantifiable dynamic range on paper substrates.
Performed analytical characterization (sensitivity, specificity, LOD) achieving PCR-level performance.
Institute for Translational Health Sciences (ITHS) TL1 Translational Research Training Fellow.
Chemical & Biological Safety Officer; received “Leading the Pack” award.

work.name: GlaxoSmithKline (via Atrium Staffing Services)
work.summary: Supported upstream/downstream development and cGMP operations.
highlights: Evaluated fermentation media components via spectrophotometry and growth curves to inform cGMP supply decisions.
Authored SOPs for formulation equipment (rheometer, microfluidizer, homogenizer).
Optimized external pump system to improve pilot-scale microfluidizer performance.
Characterized product intermediates for filtration troubleshooting and root-cause analysis.
Maintained records per cGLP and ALCOA+; escalated potential cGMP compliance/safety risks.

work.name: Montana State University — Wiedenheft Lab
highlights: Collaborated on CRISPR-Cas9 genome engineering project.
Established/optimized reporter assay for editing outcome validation.
Performed cellular cloning, mutagenesis, and development of competent E. coli lines.
Managed tissue/virus culture stocks; conducted ELISA-based quantification.
Contributed to publication on autonomous CRISPR-Cas9 delivery systems.

awards.title: “Leading the Pack” Award

projects.description: Point-of-care RPA assay development for rapid detection (SARS-CoV-2) and HIV viral-load monitoring; viscous dampening and computer vision to expand quantifiable range.
highlights: PCR-level sensitivity/specificity with antigen-test-like ease and speed.
Full-process internal control for assay robustness.
